name: Tiago Ferreira
body:
### Contact details **E-mail:** TiagoJDFerreira@gmail.com
### Work Experience ----------------------------------- **01/08/2014–31/08/2014 Research assistant** *Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm (Sweden)* Implementation in Spike2, of protocols used for optogenetic and sensory stimulation of mice. **02/2014–07/2014 Internship** *Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm (Sweden)* Analysis of slow oscillations in electrophysiological recordings of the brain.
### EDUCATION AND TRAINING ---------- **09/2013–10/2014 Erasmus Mundus Master in Systems Biology (euSYSBIO)** *Kungliga Tekniska Högskolan, Stockholm (Sweden)* Focus on neuroscience and signal processing for biomedical applications. Thesis at Karolinska Institute, in Gilad Silberberg's cortico-striatal microcircuitry lab. Title: "Catch the dream Wave - Propagation of Cortical Slow Oscillation to the Striatum in anaesthetised mice". **09/2012–05/2013** *Aalto School of Science, Helsinki (Finland)* Focus on computational biology and machine learning, with a background on life sciences. Developed some wet lab experience on high-throughput technologies. **09/2007–07/2012 Integrated Master Degree (MSc) in Aerospace Engineering** *Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa (Portugal)* Completed a total of 246 ECTS, with a focus on Avionics (aircraft electronics). Master with focus on artificial intelligence, control and systems theory, and microelectronics. Bachelor on mechanics and electronics, in the context of aircrafts. **09/2006–07/2007 1st year of Integrated Master Degree (MSc) in Biological Engineering** *Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa (Portugal)* Developed knowledge on basic sciences and mathematics for Engineering. Introduction to Life sciences and lab work.
###PERSONAL SKILLS ------------------ **Mother tongue:** Portuguese **Other languages:** Fluent in English, independent user of French and some knowledge of Spanish. **Communication skills:** Good presenter, used to discuss in public and to network on different events (competitions, seminars and workshops). Multi-cultural communication skills, acquired through my academic studies abroad, cooperation in international projects and participation in European competitions. **Computer skills:** Matlab & Simulink - Implemented projects on topics as varied as neuroscience, computational biology, optimal control or computational mathematics. Python - Implemented artificial intelligence algorithms. Knowledge of distributed version control systems such as Git and Github. R - Used for statistical analysis and processing of high-throughput data. Basic knowledge of Java and UML. Used to learn the object oriented programming paradigm. Basic knowledge of C and Fortran, acquired as an undergraduate student. Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint). Proficient user of Mac OS X and Windows 7.Some experience with different Linux distributions.
###ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ------- **Other education:** Coursera's Computational Neurosciencecourse, offered by University of Washington. CSC373: Programming a robotic car by Sebastian Thrun, offered by Udacity. Introduction to Artificial Intelligence by Sebastian Thrun and Peter Norvig, offered by Udacity. Winter Course: 4.5 ECTS, Arctic Science Winter Course 2011, 02/2011 - 03/2011. Summer Course: 10 ECTS, International Engineering Project, 08/2008 - 08/2008. Summer Course: 7.5 ECTS, Human Space Flight and Exploration, 08/2007 -08/2007. **Honours and awards:** 6th place in European Aircargo Challenge 2011; Participant in XXI Portuguese Olympiads of Math; **Memberships:** Work developed as member of the Autonomous Section of Applied Aeronautics: * Leader of avionics project in S3A's Lusitânia aircraft; * Collaborator in S3A's 1st Aeromodelling workshop; * Coordinator of S3A's 2nd and 3rd Aeromodelling workshop; + Member of S3A's Fiscal Councill in 2010.
